title.ph: eatures Supported For VMware Driver For Mitaka

body.section:
Overview
VMware Virtual Center provides options to specify limits, reservations and shares for CPU, memory, disks and network adapters. Following features are available for the VMware driver in Mitaka release:
Resource quotas for instances
Host port configuration for VMDK backend for Cinder
vSphere 6.0 Update 2

section.title: Resource quotas for instances
section.p: An extra specs can be assigned to each Nova flavor. These extra specs allow you to specify resource quota/limits. Currently these limits can be applied to memory, disks, and network adapters.

The supported flavor extra specs for quotas are as follows:
quota:memory_limit
The maximum amount of memory used by the virtual machine. Here, the term maximum is defined as a cap for the consumption of memory. The memory utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed the defined cap, even if there are available resources. This is used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines independent of available resources. Units are MB.
Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:memory_limit=512
quota:memory_reservation
Reservation guarantees the allocation of minimum memory reserved for the virtual machine. Units are MB.
Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:memory_reservation=512
quota:memory_shares_level
Shares determine relative allocation level. This can be custom, high, normal or low.
Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:memory_shares_level=custom
quota:memory_shares_share
In the event that custom is used; this is the number of shares. (what exactly will this command do? Unable to understand.?)Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:memory_shares_share=15
quota:disk_io_limit
The I/O utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit. The unit is the number of I/O per second.
Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:disk_io_limit=2000
quota:disk_io_reservation
Reservation control is used to provide guaranteed allocation in terms of IOPS (full form?).
Examplenova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:disk_io_reservation=2000
quota:disk_io_shares_level
Shares determine relative allocation level. This can be custom, high, normal or low.
Example$ nova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:disk_io_shares_level=custom
quota:disk_io_shares_share
In the event that custom is used; this is the number of shares. (what exactly will this command do? Unable to understand.?)
Examplenova flavor-key m1.medium set quota:disk_io_shares_share=200

p.b: Host port configuration for VMDK backend for Cinder

ul.li: The VMware VMDK driver supports a new configuration option vmware_host_port to specify the port number to connect to vCenter server.
Added support for images with vmware_adaptertype set to paraVirtual in the VMDK driver.
